revised_title: The Hybrid Origin and Spread of the Asexual Gecko Species Lepidodactylus lugubris
tldr: The study reveals that the asexual gecko species Lepidodactylus lugubris is of hybrid origin, with its maternal ancestor being the recently rediscovered species Lepidodactylus moestus from Micronesia, and the paternal ancestor being an undescribed species with a range from French Polynesia to the Marshall Islands. The research also shows that the so-called "bisexual" populations of L. lugubris are actually cryptic sexual species, and that the two parental species are not sister taxa. This discovery challenges the assumption that asexual species must arise through hybridization of two sexual species.
